page.title: 04Views from Rawdon School
page.content: Class 5 looked at the immediate surroundings of Rawdon C.E.School. To the North is the Billing which is 230m above sea level.The Billing is a local beauty spot and a favourite walk.Near the bottom of the Billing is a dam well stocked with fish. To the South is Rawdon Town Street on which is a Post Office and several shops.Beyond Town Street we can see across the valley.On a clear day Emley Moor T.V. mast can be seen. To the East is our school playing field,with more fields beyond.The Church Tower and clock are visible above the trees.Behind the fields planes land and take off from Leeds and Bradford Airport. To the West is Billingwood Drive and Billing View,houses for the elderly. Beyond is Rawdon Cricket Club and Rawdon Old Boys football field.
